fplogn

Class FileStructure

  • java.lang.Object
    • fplogn.FileStructure

  • public class FileStructure
extends java.lang.Object
    FileStructure class allows the user to insert Files and search them by name, size, extension, user and parent Folder with a O(log(n)) complexity. Searches are always made from HOME, but because the complexity is O(log(n)), even if there are 10^24 (1 billion squared) Files, finding one in the given categories would just take 80-82 operations. The structure is made in a way that HOME's path is "" and every Folder with a null parent is always going to be directly inside HOME.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FileStructure()
      Builds a new FileStructure.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds the given File (if not repeated) to all the trees in this class, allowing to search it with complexity O(log(n)) (n being the number of Files in the FileStructure) by name, size, extension, user and its parent folder's path.

      • getByExt

        public java.util.LinkedList<File> getByExt(java.lang.String ext)
        Searches for all the Files with the given extension, the extension has to be written without the dot, and it's found in Files as: [filename].[ext].
        Parameters:
        ext - The extension of the searched Files.
        Returns:
        A LinkedList with all Files with extension ext, returns null if there's no File with that extension.

        Parameters:
        user - The file's username.
        Returns:
        A linked list with all the Files with the given user, returns null if the username doesn't exist.

      • getByFolder

        public java.util.TreeSet<File> getByFolder(Folder folder)
        Searches all the Files with the given Folder as their parent.
        Parameters:
        folder - The searched Folder.
        Returns:
        All the files with the given Folder as it's parent, returns null if there's no File with the given Folder as its parent or the given Folder doesn't exists.

      • getByFolder

        public java.util.TreeSet<File> getByFolder(java.lang.String path)
        Searches all the Files inside the Folder with the given path. The grammar for paths is [foldername/...]. HOME path is "".
        Parameters:
        path - The path for the searched Folder.
        Returns:
        All the files in the Folder with the given path, returns null if there's no existent path with that name.

      • add

        public boolean add(File file)
        Adds the given File (if not repeated) to all the trees in this class, allowing to search it with complexity O(log(n)) (n being the number of Files in the FileStructure) by name, size, extension, user and its parent folder's path. It's allowed to insert a File without parent, then it's parent is HOME, with path "". However, any invalid File will be not added, an invalid File has at least one invalid field: name null | name.length() == 0 | user null | size less than 0
        Parameters:
        file - The File to be added.
        Returns:
        true if file added else returns false.

      • nFiles

        public long nFiles()
        The nFiles field of this FileStructure contains the number of Files (not Folders) added to the Structure.
        Returns:
        The number of Files in this FileStructure.

      • nFolders

        public long nFolders()
        The nFolders field of this FileStructure contains the number of Folders added to the Structure.
        Returns:
        the number of Folders this structure contains.
